intro: Helianthemum marifolium subsp. marifolium, commonly known as the marjoram rockrose, is a flowering plant in the family Cistaceae. It is native to the Iberian Peninsula and parts of southern France, typically growing in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are generally narrow and evergreen, adapted to dry, sunny environments. It is often used in rock gardens due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
